newsitem.title: BULGARIA: Yield falls on Bulgaria 12-mth floater T-bills.
newsitem.headline: Yield falls on Bulgaria 12-mth floater T-bills.

text.p: Yield fell at Monday's auction of Bulgaria's Finance Ministry 12-month floating interest T-bills as a cut in the main interest rate took effect, central bank figures showed.

The average yield to maturity on the issue was 51.78 percent, down from 54.49 percent at the respective auction on June 2. The average accepted price at Monday's auction was 96.95 percent of par, up from 96.18 percent a week earlier.
The issue was offered with a par of five billion levs and no minimum acceptable price set in advance, and was sold out.
Interest on the paper is due at maturity. It is set equal to the central bank main interest rate and is adjusted each time the rate is changed.
A cut in the central bank main interest rate to 47.28 percent annually from 48.72 percent took effect on Monday.
Details of the issue follow. Price in percent of par:
